He gives strong authority for the belief that Greek was included ; and if s0‚ the avowed purpose of the ordinance, which was the conversion of the Mahommedans and Jews, may not have been the only purpose ; some faint echo of Bacon’s exhorta- tion to study Aristotle and the Bible in the original, with the view of understanding them better, may have been still audible. Few and short-lived were the attempts made to carry the decree of this Council into effect. In 1320 we hear of a rate levied upon benefices in the province of Canterbury for the support of a converted Jew alleged to be teaching Greek at Oxford.
